results.title: Hit and miss
results.brief_description: Presents nine vignettes about conflict between young people and their parents. Each situation tends to be sympathetic to young people. Focuses on typically Anglo-saxon family situations.

results.title: How does it strike you?
results.brief_description: Shows a group of postprimary students role playing an industrial strike and the process of negotiation. Highlights the processes involved in an industrial strike.

results.title: Gently down the stream
results.creator_credit: Ray Costello and Education Department Western Australia
results.brief_description: Shows a Year 10 canoeing expedition on the river from Mt Franklin to the Noralup inlet, Western Australia. Demonstrates that the focus of the Outdoor Education Project is preparation for expeditions; and shows the basic understandings for wilderness and adventure activities.

results.title: High jump and pole vault
results.creator_credit: Ron Taylor and Department of Education, Queensland
results.brief_description: Shows American high jumper Nat Page, demonstrating his own style of the Fosbury flop. Presents the warm up routines, techniques and drills required for progression towards the complete skills.

results.title: Writing: making meaning
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Looks at the process of teaching children to write in the postprimary school by focusing on teaching methods of three teachers. Stresses that writing for meaning comes first and mechanics of writing second. Narrated by Diane O’Connor.
